subject: Business
title: Real Estate as an Investment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Real Estate as an Investment.

hook.text: You buy a $200,000 property with $40,000 down. It appreciates 5%. Your $40,000 just earned 25% because of leverage.

buildup.text: Real estate builds wealth through appreciation, rental income, tax benefits, and the power of leverage.

discovery.text: Leverage amplifies returns: you control a $200K asset with $40K. Stocks don't offer this kind of magnification.

twist.text: Leverage amplifies losses too. A 20% drop wipes out your entire down payment. Real estate is not risk-free.

climax.text: The 2008 crash showed what happens when leverage goes wrong. Millions lost homes and life savings.

punchline.text: Leverage is a powerful tool. Handle it with respect, not recklessness.

quiz.question: How does leverage amplify real estate returns?
options: You control a large asset with a small down payment, so appreciation is magnified
